name: Christine Widden

work_experience.title: Software Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer Intern
description: Developed Python test scripts in TestComplete to automate UI localization testing, verifying multi-language functionality for client-facing applications.
Improved test coverage and streamlined bug reporting, reducing manual testing and contributing to efficient, high-quality software releases.

work_experience.title: Interactive Entertainment Instructional Student Assistant
description: Advised students on setting up development environments, managing work balance with a group, and developing and debugging their games made in Unity, Inform7, Godot, and Unreal Engine, and written in languages such as C#, C++, and Python.
Aided Dr. April Grow in grading student’s game analysis essays and other writeups.
Provided further game development advice and programming assistance outside of class hours.

work_experience.title: Software Development Engineer in Test Intern
description: Was responsible for developing the entire automated UI test suite for an application.
Taught myself to use the Playwright test automation library with TypeScript based on my experience with Selenium.
Utilized Git and GitHub Actions for version control and reviewed the pull requests of coworkers, updated codebase through CI/CD, and utilized Agile and Jira for task and project management.

work_experience.title: Software Development Engineer in Test Intern
Corporate Enterprise Architecture Intern
description: Reported to the IT Architect and assisted with the management of data relating to the internal Enterprise Architecture Group.
Automated consolidation of data from different sources in Excel, utilizing macros and the VLOOKUP formula.
Facilitated communication between manager and team in the creation of SharePoint pages to organize department information and appointments on an internal company website.

skills: C#, C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, Others

schools.name: California Polytechnic State University
schools.details: GPA 3.70, Focusing my studies on artificial intelligence, machine learning, and game development.

courses.name: Artificial Intelligence: Graduate Level
courses.description: An in-depth look into high-level artificial intelligence concepts, with focus on team projects.

courses.name: Knowledge Discovery from Data
courses.description: A rigorous study in data mining and machine learning, and algorithms such as word2vec, logistic regression, and collaborative filtering.

courses.name: Computer Graphics
courses.description: OpenGl in C++, covering fundamentals of computer graphics, rendering, and GPU usage.

courses.name: Computer Animation
courses.description: Continuation of Computer Graphics, with a focus on 3D animation with OpenGL.

courses.name: Calculus 4
courses.description: Partial derivatives, multiple integrals, introduction to vector analysis.

courses.name: Linear Algebra
courses.description: Systems of linear equations, matrix algebra, including inverses and determinants.

courses.name: Game Design
courses.description: Developing a C#-based games in Unity, alongside an in-depth look into the principles behind good game design.

courses.name: User-Centered Interface Design and Development
courses.description: Learning the principles behind designing a UI that users will find intuitive and accessible. Assisted with the development of an app and ran user experience experiments.

courses.name: Software Development
courses.description: Software Development pipeline, version control with Git, and React. Worked on developing web apps with a team while following the software development lifecycle.

courses.name: Deep Learning
courses.description: An exploration of how various deep learning systems work, such as natural language processing, generative models, and recurrent neural networks.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Security
courses.description: A hands-on course in computer system and network security. Utilized tools such as Postman to explore network security and learn how to protect against weaknesses.

projects.name: Master's Thesis: The Impact of Accessibility Features on Player Experience in Video Games
desc: A 60-page thesis about my study on accessibility in video games, for my Master's in Computer Science from Cal Poly.

projects.name: Alien Invasion
desc: Worked with a team to develop a Unity-based tower defense game written in the language C#.
Utilized Object-Oriented Programming concepts to develop a modular and scalable upgrade system, allowing for complex game mechanics with fast development and minimal bugs.
Continuously playtested the game with new users to ensure proper balance and an enjoyable play experience by collecting feedback.
Regularly met with the team to ensure efficient and balanced work division.

projects.name: Computer Graphics Projects
desc: Completed various OpenGL projects in C++ to learn and understand 3D graphics rendering and animating.

projects.name: Goblin Chase
desc: A Unity-based 2D platformer and shooter game, developed for the Interactive Entertainment Engineering course.
Regularly met with the team to ensure efficient and balanced work division.

projects.name: Operating Systems Assigned Projects
desc: Created simulated process scheduler, a Light Weight Process library (LWP or threads), Virtual Memory simulator, simulated Disk Scheduler, and a File System and Disk emulator.
Technologies: C++, GNU, File IO

projects.name: Curated Resume Builder
desc: Wrote a web app that allows me to more efficiently create resumes for jobs, allowing the user to check off skills and experience from a masterlist in order to generate a PDF accordingly.
Technologies: Python, JavaScript, Node, CSS, HTML

projects.name: Task Management IOS App
desc: Developed an IOS app for managing daily tasks and helping the user prioritize for the best possible productivity.
Technologies: Swift

projects.name: Notes Made Easy
desc: Worked with a team while following the software development life cycle to create a note-taking web app and connected the backend to MongoDB via Mongoose. Implemented a text editing library.
Technologies: Mongoose, MongoDB, React, HTTP requests, JavaScript

projects.name: Discord Chat Bots
desc: Designed interactive chatbots for Discord. Used internal database to manage currency for multiple users
Technologies: JavaScript, the Discord JavaScript library, Google API, OAuth, Node JSON DB

projects.name: Image2Recipe
desc: Used a Convolutional Neural Network to identify common ingredients in photos of groceries set out, in order to suggest recipes to the user.
Primarily utilized tensorflow and numpy.

projects.name: Prisoner's Dilemma AI
desc: Created an AI that learns to play Prisoner's Dilemma by facing off against the most popular algorithms. AI achieved performance equivalent to that of the best algorithmic agent.
Deep-learning driven AI utilizes Recurrent Proximal Policy Optimization, Multilayer Perceptrons, and Long Short-Term Memory. Python-based.

projects.name: Recipe Recommendation System
desc: A team project for Knowledge Discovery from Data, in which collaborative filtering was used to analyze grocery basket kaggle datasets and recommend recipes based on the ingredients a user possessed.

extra_section_contents: Dungeons and Dragons, Skyrim, The Legend of Zelda Series, Minecraft
In my free time, I enjoy playing Dungeons and Dragons with friends, writing, drawing, and making and playing video games!
